availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frank P. Cotton (Woodford County, Kentucky, student and soldier.)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, student and soldier. Son of Charles Cotton and Sarah B. Puryear Cotton. Resident of Woodford County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned eighteen enslaved persons in Woodford in 1850. Student in Woodford County in 1860. Household owned thirty-four enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from July 16, 1862 to January 23, 1865. Captured at Buffington, Meigs County, Ohio, on July 19, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Morton, Marion County, Indiana, from July 23, 1863 to August 22, 1863. Prisoner of War at Camp Douglas, Cook County, Illinois, from August 22, 1863 to January 23, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the Government of the United States on January 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
